title: The Living Archive
outcome: Citizens and returned survivors, energized by the leak of BCI abuses and the collapse of Council credibility, uncover encrypted archive fragments personally left by Halden. As these are decoded, evidence exposes systemic, Council-driven score manipulation and erasures going back to the BCI’s pilot days. A citizen-led public tribunal and mass resignations force a new chapter in city governance.

events.description: Volunteers crowd public halls and former BCI access points, searching encrypted archives for hidden evidence tied to Halden’s personal files.
Decoded fragments reveal Council members ordered retroactive score changes and citizen disappearances since the BCI’s pilot phase. Survivor testimonies are matched to digital evidence.
Outraged citizens begin livestreamed tribunals. Council members are confronted one by one; systemic abuses are exposed in detail.
Amid growing pressure, the first mass resignations from the Council occur live, triggering emergency elections for interim oversight by open public vote.
A coalition of survivors proposes the next system for civic trust—emphasizing transparency and public oversight—in a citywide assembly that draws unprecedented crowds.
